Good Comments: Very good subs in basically every area. The subbers seem to have played the sound novels and know what they are talking about. #1 recommendation for this show is SEACATS.

If you want speed-subs look elsewhere, these guys take their time.
The quality of the video and translations is quite high however.
I approve.
poor styling, awkward sentences, aniki, bad typesetting (sweet nameplates, bros). still, much better than ainex, hatsuyuki & darksoul.
Very good group, attention to detail, good font, good timing... generally pleased with everything.
While slow in getting stuff out compared to other groups the quality of the end product is much much better.
The fansubbing that they did for Umineko no Naku Koro Ni was incredibly well done. It followed the visual novel almost to the letter, and is by far the best current group subbing Umineko.
took them quite long and the editing wasn't smooth enough for that timeframe..

seriously. look at the fansub name and you'll see exactly why they're the group for this particular anime. in case those who aren't up to snuff... umi=sea; neko=cat. what do you get? umineko=seacats! lol
Blatantly copying from the VN is never good, as it always backfires. Which it did in this case. Seacats sucks, GG fixed all their problems from episode 2 on.

They're the only ones knowing what on Earth they are doing.
There were no errors in the subtitles, and all sentences were grammatically correct. No timing errors either, definitely not low-rate speedsubs!
